summary.long: Colossians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy our brother,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To the saints and faithful brethren in Christ who are in Colosse:
Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We give thanks to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, praying always for you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since we heard of your faith in Christ Jesus and of your love for all the saints;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because of the hope which is laid up for you in heaven, of which you heard before in the word of the truth of the gospel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which has come to you, as it has also in all the world, and is bringing forth fruit, as it is also among you since the day you heard and knew the grace of God in truth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as you also learned from Epaphras, our dear fellow servant, who is a faithful minister of Christ on your behalf,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who also declared to us your love in the Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason we also, since the day we heard it, do not cease to pray for you, and to ask that you may be filled with the knowledge of His will in all wisdom and spiritual understanding;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you may walk worthy of the Lord, fully pleasing Him, being fruitful in every good work and increasing in the knowledge of God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: strengthened with all might, according to His glorious power, for all patience and longsuffering with joy;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: giving thanks to the Father who has qualified us to be partakers of the inheritance of the saints in the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has delivered us from the power of darkness and conveyed us into the kingdom of the Son of His love,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in whom we have redemption through His blood, the forgiveness of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn over all creation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by Him all things were created that are in heaven and that are on earth, visible and invisible, whether thrones or dominions or principalities or powers. All things were created through Him and for Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He is before all things, and in Him all things consist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He is the head of the body, the church, who is the beginning, the firstborn from the dead, that in all things He may have the preeminence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it pleased the Father that in Him all the fullness should dwell,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and by Him to reconcile all things to Himself, by Him, whether things on earth or things in heaven, having made peace through the blood of His cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, who once were alienated and enemies in your mind by wicked works, yet now He has reconciled
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the body of His flesh through death, to present you holy, and blameless, and above reproach in His sight—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if indeed you continue in the faith, grounded and steadfast, and are not moved away from the hope of the gospel which you heard, which was preached to every creature under heaven, of which I, Paul, became a minister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I now rejoice in my sufferings for you, and fill up in my flesh what is lacking in the afflictions of Christ, for the sake of His body, which is the church,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of which I became a minister according to the stewardship from God which was given to me for you, to fulfill the word of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the mystery which has been hidden from ages and from generations, but now has been revealed to His saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To them God willed to make known what are the riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles: which is Christ in you, the hope of glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Him we preach, warning every man and teaching every man in all wisdom, that we may present every man perfect in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To this end I also labor, striving according to His working which works in me mightily.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I want you to know what a great conflict I have for you and those in Laodicea, and for as many as have not seen my face in the flesh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that their hearts may be encouraged, being knit together in love, and attaining to all riches of the full assurance of understanding, to the knowledge of the mystery of God, both of the Father and of Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in whom are hidden all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this I say lest anyone should deceive you with persuasive words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For though I am absent in the flesh, yet I am with you in spirit, rejoicing to see your good order and the steadfastness of your faith in Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As you therefore have received Christ Jesus the Lord, so walk in Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: rooted and built up in Him and established in the faith, as you have been taught, abounding in it with thanksgiving.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beware lest anyone cheat you through philosophy and empty deceit, according to the tradition of men, according to the basic principles of the world, and not according to Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in Him dwells all the fullness of the Godhead bodily;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you are complete in Him, who is the head of all principality and power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Him you were also circumcised with the circumcision made without hands, by putting off the body of the sins of the flesh, by the circumcision of Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: buried with Him in baptism, in which you also were raised with Him through faith in the working of God, who raised Him from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, being dead in your trespasses and the uncircumcision of your flesh, He has made alive together with Him, having forgiven you all trespasses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having wiped out the handwriting of requirements that was against us, which was contrary to us. And He has taken it out of the way, having nailed it to the cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Having disarmed principalities and powers, He made a public spectacle of them, triumphing over them in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So let no one judge you in food or in drink, or regarding a festival or a new moon or sabbaths,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which are a shadow of things to come, but the substance is of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let no one cheat you of your reward, taking delight in false humility and worship of angels, intruding into those things which he has not seen, vainly puffed up by his fleshly mind,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and not holding fast to the Head, from whom all the body, nourished and knit together by joints and ligaments, grows with the increase that is from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, if you died with Christ from the basic principles of the world, why, as though living in the world, do you subject yourselves to regulations—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not touch, do not taste, do not handle,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which all concern things which perish with the using—according to the commandments and doctrines of men?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things indeed have an appearance of wisdom in self-imposed religion, false humility, and neglect of the body, but are of no value against the indulgence of the flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If then you were raised with Christ, seek those things which are above, where Christ is, sitting at the right hand of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Set your mind on things above, not on things on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you died, and your life is hidden with Christ in God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Christ who is our life appears, then you also will appear with Him in glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore put to death your members which are on the earth: fornication, uncleanness, passion, evil desire, and covetousness, which is idolatry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of these things the wrath of God is coming upon the sons of disobedience,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in which you yourselves once walked when you lived in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now you yourselves are to put off all these: anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy, filthy language out of your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not lie to one another, since you have put off the old man with his deeds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and have put on the new man who is renewed in knowledge according to the image of Him who created him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: where there is neither Greek nor Jew, circumcised nor uncircumcised, barbarian, Scythian, slave nor free, but Christ is all and in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, as the elect of God, holy and beloved, put on tender mercies, kindness, humility, meekness, longsuffering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: bearing with one another, and forgiving one another, if anyone has a complaint against another; even as Christ forgave you, so you also must do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But above all these things put on love, which is the bond of perfection.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let the peace of God rule in your hearts, to which also you were called in one body; and be thankful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly in all wisdom, teaching and admonishing one another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing with grace in your hearts to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whatever you do in word or deed, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wives, submit to your own husbands, as is fitting in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Husbands, love your wives and do not be bitter toward them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Children, obey your parents in all things, for this is well pleasing to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fathers, do not provoke your children, lest they become discouraged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bondservants, obey in all things your masters according to the flesh, not with eyeservice, as men-pleasers, but in sincerity of heart, fearing God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whatever you do, do it heartily, as to the Lord and not to men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: knowing that from the Lord you will receive the reward of the inheritance; for you serve the Lord Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who does wrong will be repaid for what he has done, and there is no partiality.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Masters, give your bondservants what is just and fair, knowing that you also have a Master in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Continue earnestly in prayer, being vigilant in it with thanksgiving;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: meanwhile praying also for us, that God would open to us a door for the word, to speak the mystery of Christ, for which I am also in chains,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that I may make it manifest, as I ought to speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Walk in wisdom toward those who are outside, redeeming the time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let your speech always be with grace, seasoned with salt, that you may know how you ought to answer each one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tychicus, a beloved brother, faithful minister, and fellow servant in the Lord, will tell you all the news about me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am sending him to you for this very purpose, that he may know your circumstances and comfort your hearts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with Onesimus, a faithful and beloved brother, who is one of you. They will make known to you all things which are happening here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aristarchus my fellow prisoner greets you, with Mark the cousin of Barnabas (about whom you received instructions: if he comes to you, welcome him),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jesus who is called Justus. These are my only fellow workers for the kingdom of God who are of the circumcision; they have proved to be a comfort to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Epaphras, who is one of you, a bondservant of Christ, greets you, always laboring fervently for you in prayers, that you may stand perfect and complete in all the will of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I bear him witness that he has a great zeal for you, and those who are in Laodicea, and those in Hierapolis.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Luke the beloved physician and Demas greet you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Greet the brethren who are in Laodicea, and Nymphas and the church that is in his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when this epistle is read among you, see that it is read also in the church of the Laodiceans, and that you likewise read the epistle from Laodicea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And say to Archippus, “Take heed to the ministry which you have received in the Lord, that you may fulfill it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This salutation by my own hand—Paul. Remember my chains. Grace be with you. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
